Even if you’re not a beer nerd, Dieu du Ciel makes over 150 varieties, from stouts to IPAs to sour ales, so you’re sure to find something you dig. Sure, there’s a selection of cocktails, scotch, and whiskies, but everyone is here for the beer. If you’re hungry, the micropub has a kitchen, so you can get individual pizzas, sandwiches, and other pub snacks.THE VIBE IS: relaxed at any time of day (or night). Despite its reputation for making superlative microbrews, Dieu du Ciel has an unassuming, unpretentious air, so beer noobs can feel at ease.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open every day 11:30 a.m. to 3 a.m., with the kitchen open until midnight and snacks available until 2 a.m. Heads up: Kids accompanied by parents are welcome during the day, but after 8 p.m. it’s 18 and up.—Claire SaffitzSamuel JoubertSamuel JoubertWE ALSO LOVELarrysA natural wine bar that also serves the best breakfast in Mile EndCafé OlimpicoGet your caffeine fix at this Mile End espresso shopSt-Viateur Bagel ShopSettle the great bagel debate by getting a dozen at the famed Mile End mini chainExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
